body: A pipe bomb exploded under a limousine parked in the Bath Beach section of Brooklyn yesterday, but no one was in the car at the time and no injuries were reported, the police said. The car, apparently rented or leased, was badly damaged in the explosion at 4:28 P.M. at Bay 14th and 86th Streets, said a police spokesman, Officer Judy Ciani.
title: Bomb Damages Limousine

body: A car containing several dangerous insecticides was stolen in Brooklyn yesterday morning when an exterminator left the car running while he bought a soda in a store, the police said. The exterminator, Michael Bruhert of Valley Stream, L.I., said the 1975 four-door, silver Oldsmobile Regency 98 was stolen from outside the store at Shore Parkway and
title: Chemicals Taken in Car Theft

body: A man suspected of holding up two Upper East Side supermarkets with a shotgun yesterday morning and fleeing in a stolen Porsche with license plates that read ''THE IT'' was arrested later while driving the car in Brooklyn, the police said. A police spokesman, Sgt. Raymond O'Donnell, said the man, 25-year-old Kevin Stein of 221 Eighth Avenue in
title: Police Seize Suspect in Rash Of Holdups at Supermarkets

body: BOUNTIFUL BROOKLYN There is often more to Brooklyn than meets the eye, and an exhibition that opens today, in Brooklyn, of course, is intended to let the modern eye meet scenes and artistic items from a Brooklyn that has, like old New York across the river, largely vanished. ''Brooklyn's Bounty: Natural Splendor and Domestic Opulence'' contains
title: GOING OUT GUIDE;
